tutorial.speak:
For advanced users, we have the ability to add any custom HTML you wish to the page. You will need to know HTML and JAvascript in order to use this element type.
Add your HTML and your Javascript and click "Save". Do not include the Script tag in your Javascript.
The Javascript will not execute while in the page designer..
but will when the page is loaded by a visitor.
The embed element allows you to add an i-frame to the page. This is useful for embedding content from other providers you may use for donations, forms, etc.
Set the url you wish to load and the height of the frame and click Save.
The external website will be embedded on the page.
You have the ability to add animations and custom styles to every element and section.
Animations run when an element first becomes visible.
Simply choose the animation type and how fast you want it to run. Then click Update and Save.
When you visit the page
The animation will run.
This is a great way to add some flair to your page.
If you need to customize an element in a way that the built in options do not permit, you can likely do so with styles.
Click "Add Style" under all platforms to get started.
There are many options to choose from.
You can adjust the color, padding, margin, font, shadow, and more.
When you're done you can see all the options you have set, and further customize just for desktop or mobile.
Click "Save" to see your changes applied.
